p: • Engagement with meaning is an implicit (“non-thematic”), foresightful absorption in a set of references that constitute the usefulness of a group of tools.
• I can care about things only because I am already familiar with a world of practical meaning.
• I can become so intensely absorbed in something that I get lost in my fascination with it.
• What exactly is this world of meaning that I am already familiar with?
• How is it that a thing’s worldly character (the fact that it is within meaning) can “light up”?
• What precisely is the referential structure that gets disrupted such that the objective presence of things “stands out”?
